servinfo.title: Rear Suspension knuckle Removal and Installation

s1.ptxt: Hoist vehicle and remove rear wheels.
Remove rear wheel hub assembly referring to Rear Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove wheel sensor (1).
Loosen rear brake hose bracket bolt (1).
Support lower arm with jack.
Loosen control rod outer bolt, trailing rod rear bolt and lower arm outer bolt referring to the figure in Rod and Arm Components .
Disconnect upper arm joint from rear suspension knuckle (1) with puller (2) and remove rear suspension knuckle.

attention3.ptxt: Do not remove upper arm joint nut (3) to avoid the rear suspension knuckle fall off.

s1.ptxt: Connect upper arm joint (2) to rear suspension knuckle (1).
Tighten new upper arm joint nut (3) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: Do not reuse removed upper arm joint nut.

s1.ptxt: Install lower arm, trailing rod and control rod to rear suspension knuckle referring to the figure in Rod and Arm Components and tighten bolts temporarily by hand.

attention2.ptxt: If reuse lower arm outer bolt, trailing rod rear bolt and control rod outer bolt, apply engine oil to thread, bearing and trunk surface.

s1.ptxt: Remove floor jack from lower arm.
Install rear brake hose bracket (1) and then tighten rear brake hose bracket bolt (2) to specified torque.
Install wheel sensor (1) and then tighten wheel sensor bolt (2) to specified torque.
Install rear wheel hub assembly referring to Rear Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation .
Fill reservoir with brake fluid and bleed brake system. Refer to Air Bleeding of Brake System .

Upon completion of all jobs, depress brake pedal with about 30 kg (66 lbs) load a few times so as to obtain proper drum-to-shoe clearance. Adjust parking brake cable. Refer to Parking Brake Check and Adjustment .
Install rear wheels.
Check to ensure that brake drum is free from dragging and proper braking is obtained.
Lower hoist and tighten rear wheel bolts to specified torque.
Bounce vehicle up and down to stabilize suspension.
Tighten each bolts to specified torque with vehicle weight on suspension.

attention3.ptxt: It is the most desirable to have vehicle off hoist and in non-loaded condition when tightening them.

s1.ptxt: Perform brake test (foot brake and parking brake).
Check each installed part for fluid leakage.
Check rear toe and camber adjust it as necessary. For check and adjustment procedures, refer to Rear Wheel Alignment Inspection and Adjustment .
